children.name: value
children.description: Gets/Sets the value of the barcode.

children.name: svg
Example - get the SVG representation of the barcode

children.description: Returns the [SVG](http://www.w3.org/Graphics/SVG/) representation of the barcode. The returned string is a self-contained SVG document that can be used as is or converted to other formats using tools like [Inkscape](http://inkscape.org/) and[ImageMagick](http://www.imagemagick.org/). Both programs provide command-line interface suitable for server-side processing.> This method is obsoleted by [exportSVG](#methods-exportSVG), but will remain fully functional.

children.name: resize

parameters.name: force `Boolean` *optional*
parameters.description: Defines whether the widget should proceed with resizing even if the element dimensions have not changed.

children.description: Adjusts the widget layout to match the size of the container.

children.name: redraw
children.description: Redraws the barcode.

children.name: imageDataURL
Example - show a snapshot of the Barcode

children.description: Returns a PNG image of the barcode encoded as a [Data URL](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/data_URIs).> This method is deprecated and replaced by [exportImage](#methods-exportImage).

children.name: exportSVG
Example - Exporting a barcode to an SVG document

parameters.name: options.raw `Boolean` *(default: false)*
parameters.description: Resolves the promise with the raw SVG document without the Data URI prefix.

children.description: Exports the barcode as an SVG document.The result can be saved using [kendo.saveAs](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-saveAs).The export operation is asynchronous and returns a [promise](http://api.jquery.com/Types/#Promise).The promise will be resolved with a SVG document encoded as a [Data URI](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/data_URIs).

children.name: exportPDF
Example - Exporting a barcode to a PDF file

parameters.name: options `kendo.drawing.PDFOptions` *(optional)*
parameters.description: Parameters for the exported PDF file.

children.description: Exports the barcode as a PDF file.The result can be saved using [kendo.saveAs](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-saveAs).The export operation is asynchronous and returns a [promise](http://api.jquery.com/Types/#Promise).The promise will be resolved with a PDF file encoded as a [Data URI](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/data_URIs).

children.name: exportImage
Example - Exporting a barcode to an image

parameters.name: options.height `String`
parameters.description: The height of the exported image. Defaults to the barcode height.

parameters.name: options.width `String`
parameters.description: The width of the exported image. Defaults to the barcode width.

children.description: Exports the barcode as an image.The result can be saved using [kendo.saveAs](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-saveAs).The export operation is asynchronous and returns a [promise](http://api.jquery.com/Types/#Promise).The promise will be resolved with a PNG image encoded as a [Data URI](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/data_URIs).

children.name: width
children.description: The width of the barcode in pixels.  By default the width is 300.

children.name: value
children.description: The initial value of the Barcode

children.name: type
children.description: The symbology (encoding) the barcode will use.The supported values are:* EAN8* EAN13* UPCE* UPCA* Code11* Code39* Code39Extended* Code93* Code93Extended* Code128* Code128A* Code128B* Code128C* GS1-128* MSImod10* MSImod11* MSImod1010* MSImod1110* POSTNET

children.name: text.visible
children.description: If set to false the barcode will not display the value as a text below the barcode lines.

children.name: text.margin.top
children.description: The top margin of the text.

children.name: text.margin.right
children.description: The right margin of the text.

children.name: text.margin.left
children.description: The left margin of the text.

children.name: text.margin.bottom
children.description: The bottom margin of the text.

children.name: text.margin
Example - set the margin of the text.

children.description: The margin of the text

children.name: text.font
children.default: "16px Consolas, Monaco, Sans Mono, monospace, sans-serif"
children.description: The font of the text.

children.name: text.color
children.description: The color of the text. Any valid CSS color string will work here, including hex and rgb.

children.name: text
children.description: Can be set to a JavaScript object which represents the text configuration.

children.name: padding.top
children.description: The top padding of the barcode.

children.name: padding.right
children.description: The right padding of the barcode.

children.name: padding.left
children.description: The left padding of the barcode.

children.name: padding.bottom
children.description: The bottom padding of the barcode.

children.name: padding
Example - set the padding of the barcode

children.description: The padding of the barcode.

children.name: height
children.description: The height of the barcode in pixels.  By default the height is 100.

children.name: color
children.description: The color of the bar elements.Any valid CSS color string will work here, including hex and rgb.

children.name: checksum
children.description: If set to `true` the barcode will not display the checksum digit next to the value in the text area.

children.name: border.width
children.description: The width of the border.

children.name: border.dashType
children.description: The dash type of the border.

children.name: border.color
children.description: The color of the border. Any valid CSS color string will work here, including hex and rgb.

children.name: border
Example - set the border of the barcode

children.description: The border of the barcode area.

children.name: background
children.description: The background of the barcode area.Any valid CSS color string will work here, including hex and rgb.

children.name: renderAs
Example - Render as SVG, if supported

children.description: Sets the preferred rendering engine.If it is not supported by the browser, the Barcode will switch to the first available mode.The supported values are:* "canvas" - renders the widget as a Canvas element, if available.* "svg" - renders the widget as inline SVG document, if available* "vml" - renders the widget as VML, if available
